Seems like a bunch of them failed with `Jmx tool took too long to start`, sadly.

@guozhangwang Sorry, I was going to wait for an update on the kafka-core module vs code duplication, and then I went on PTO for two weeks! I will try to get my changes in soon (I'm returning to the US in a few days), but before that, would you mind addressing the comment from @mjsax about the above?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/1466/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@dguy LGTM overall. I have a couple of meta comments: I think the proposal is to take file's mtime into consideration, but I'm still wondering how much it can help with the race condition: if the other thread has not grabbed the lock, then this file will not be modified since its task was migrated out while store is flushed; if the other thread has already grabbed the lock, then we will not enter the critical path anyways, is that right?

One minor detailed comment: we need to update `StreamsConfig.STATE_CLEANUP_DELAY_MS_DOC` as well.

@guozhangwang that is true, but in the usual case. The rebalance is happening reasonably quickly, so the chances of the directories being deleted is quite low. So it won't completely eliminate it, but generally it would be gone.

To completely eliminate we need to add some shared state in StreamThread so we know not to do the cleanup unless rebalancing has completed for all threads. I can do that - WDYT?

Not sure what happened to my previous comment, but: I ended up addressing most of the comments here tonight. Could you let me know whether the changes are acceptable, and what you'd like regarding the addition of `Topic.java` vs using the kafka-core module? Thanks!
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@miguno @dguy @enothereska @guozhangwang (\cc @derrickdoo about the links -- hope I got them right)
"retest this please"
@dguy Could you rebase and update the config doc? Otherwise LGTM.
Not sure if we want to do this or not with js redirect. Will leave it to @derrickdoo for suggestions.

Hi @twbecker, thanks for taking a look!  Be sure to also check out the discussion thread here: https://www.mail-archive.com/dev@kafka.apache.org/msg65697.html

Unfortunately, as far as I know, there is no way to allow the server to use a default replication factor when making a CreateTopicsRequest.  The RPC must have either a manual partitioning assignment, or a number of replicas and number of partitions specified.

I think supporting server-side defaults would be a nice improvement, but it would require a separate KIP to implement.

Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

All the failures are for tests which use the old consumer. It is possible that there are still holes where the old consumer is trying to read missing JMX attributes, causing the tool to wait forever for output. Causing the consumer fail on start (since it starts the JMX tool before doing anything else).

The only thing missing with my hypothesis in the previous comment is that the consumer logs indicate that it starts and consumers messages. It's just that none of the messages are relayed back  over ssh.
@mjsax @dguy would you mind to review again please?
@guozhangwang have a look if you can.

Thanks for this PR. Because this is a public API change, it is required to do a KIP first: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+Improvement+Proposals

If you need any help with preparing a KIP, please ask for help at the dev mailing list.
